div.ab:
بــســم اللّــه الرّحمــن الرّحيم
شهد الشّهود المسمّون في هذا الكتاب على إقرار أنتناس أنتباس أننياس أساس بن سسنّه بن أنتباس أنتباس أننياس أساس السّاكن القرية المعــروفــة
بنواية من قرى أسفل أشمون أنّــه حضر عندهم وأشــهدهــم علــى نــفســه في صحّة من عقله وبدنه وجواز
أمره أن سلائح سلائح أراضي الأمــلاك المعروفة بهور قلته والمنسوبة إلى بقام بن هلستوس ممّا كان
باسم جرجه قزمان بدلالة نــواية مــمّــا كان تقبّل به مزاحم بن إسحق بن مــحمّد بن أحمد عامل أبي أحمد الحسن
بن محــمّــد على أعــمــال الخراج والضّــيــاع واپحرى وأحرى قراهما بكور الأشمونين لأربع سنين متواليات
أوليهن سنة اثني عشــرة وثلثماية وآخرتهن سنة خمس عشرة وثلثماية بعشرين دينارا عيونا
ذهبا مثاقيل معسولة بنــقد بيت الــمــال ووزنه ســوى ما يجب فيه مــن الأجرة والا فأنّهما
خارجان عن هذه الجمــله الجمله بحساب خمسة دنانير لكل سنة أن ذلك ملكا له ولآباه قبله وأنّه
قبــالــة مــزاحــم بــن إســحق وذلك إليه أن يسلّم إليه ذلك فســلّــم مــزاحم بن إسحق إلى أننياس أنتباس أننياس أساس بن سسنّه
بــن أنتباس أنتباس أننياس أساس النّوائي إليه ذلك وأقر أنتباس أنتباس أننياس أساس بن سسنّه بن أنتناس أنتباس أننياس أساس النّوائي أنّه تسلّم من مزاحم
بن إسحق سلائخ أراضي الأملاك المذكورة في هذا الكتاب وحازها لنفسه وزرعها
وأسجل من شا وزرع من أحب وألزم نفسه عمارة ذلك والتمام بها على الشّرائط الثّابتة
في ديوان الخراج دون مزاحم بن إسحق ولدفــع أنتناس أنتباس أننياس أساس بن سسنّه بن أنتباس أنتباس أننياس أساس النّوائي جميع خراج ذلك
عمّا يجب لحق بيت المال دون حق لــمــا من خراج سلائخ أراضي الأمــلاك المذكورة في هذا
الــكــتاب دون لسپپپن مزاحم مپوالپپپن بن اولپهن إسحق سپه ارپع عسره وپــلپمــاپه
وآخرتهنّ سنة خمس عشرة وثلثــمــايــة عــلى الــشّرائط الثّابتة في ديوان الخراج بالـمال
ا على أن يودى مال ما الخراج
عليــهــا عليهما وواجب عليه أداپها معما يجب
‮ ــان من الرّسم في ذلك دون مزاحم بن إسحق
لا يدافعه ولا يحتج فيه بحجّة بوجه من الوجوه ولا سبب
من الأسباب صپة ولا ظمأ ولا استبحار ولا على الوجوه والأسباب
كلّـها من السّنين المورحه في هذا الكتاب
من قبل أحد من السّلاطين أو أصحاب الخراج أو عمّالهم كتّابهم
من الوجوه والأســباب كلّها فعلى أنتباس أنتباس أننياس أساس بن سسنّه بن أنتناس أنتباس أننياس أساس النّوائي
من خالص ماله وأوفره وأخصره وضمــن له جميع ذلك ضــمــانا لازما له في ذمّتــه

bi ĭsmi ăl lāhi ăr raḥmāni ăr raḥīmi
šahida ăš šuhūdu ăl musammawna fī hāḏā ăl kitābi ʿalà ʾiqrāri ʾananiyāsa ʾantanāsa ʾantibāsa ʾasāsa bni sisinnaha bni ʾananiyāsa ʾantanāsa ʾantibāsa ʾasāsa ăs sākini ăl qaryaẗa ăl maʿrūfaẗa
bi nawāyaẗa min qurà ʾasfali ʾušmūna ʾanna hu ḥaḍara ʿinda hum wa ʾašhada hum ʿalà nafsi hi fī ṣiḥḥaẗ:in min ʿaqli hi wa badani hi wa ǧawāzi
ʾamri hi ʾanna salāʾiḥa salāʾiḫa ʾarāḍī ăl ʾamlāki ăl maʿrūfaẗi bi hūr qultaha wa ăl mansūbaẗi ʾilà buqāma bni hilistūsa mimmā kāna
bi ĭsmi ǧirǧahi quzmāna bi dilālaẗi nawāyaẗa mimmā kāna taqabbala bi hi muzāḥimu bnu ʾisḥāqa bni muḥammadi bni ʾaḥmada ʿāmilu ʾabī ʾaḥmada ăl ḥasani
bni muḥammad:in ʿalà ʾaʿmāli ăl ḫarāǧi wa ăḍ ḍiyāʿi wa ʾaḥrà ʾBḥry qurā humā bi kuwari ăl ʾušmūnayni li ʾarbaʿi sinīna mutawāliyāt:in
ʾūlà hunna sanaẗu ĭṯnay ʿašraẗa wa ṯalāṯi miʾaẗ:in wa ʾāḫiraẗu hunna sanaẗu ḫamsa ʿašraẗa wa ṯalāṯi miʾaẗ:in bi ʿišrīna dīnār:an ʿuyūn:an
ḏahab:an maṯāqīla maʿsūlaẗ:an bi naqdi bayti ăl māli wa wazni hi siwà mā yaǧibu fī hi min ăl ʾuǧraẗi wa ăl ʾ*** **** fa ʾanna humā
ḫāriǧāni ʿan hāḏihi ăl ḥimlaẗi ǧumlaẗ bi ḥisābi ḫamsaẗi danānīra li kulli sanaẗ:in ʾanna ḏālika milk:an la hu wa li ʾābāʾi hi qabla hu wa ʾanna hu
qabālaẗu muzāḥima bni ʾisḥāqa wa ḏālika ʾilay hi ʾan yusallima ʾilay hi ḏālika fa sallama muzāḥimu bnu ʾisḥāqa ʾilà ʾananiyāsa ʾantanāsa ʾantibāsa ʾasāsa bni sisinnaha
bni ʾananiyāsa ʾantanāsa ʾantibāsa ʾasāsa ăn nawāʾiyyi ʾilay hi ḏālika wa ʾaqarra ʾananiyāsu ʾantanāsu ʾantibāsu ʾasāsu bnu sisinnaha bni ʾananiyāsa ʾantanāsa ʾantibāsa ʾasāsa ăn nawāʾiyyu ʾanna hu tasallama min muzāḥima
bni ʾisḥāqa salāʾiḫa ʾarāḍī ăl ʾamlāki ăl maḏkūraẗi fī hāḏā ăl kitābi wa ḥāza hā li nafsi hi wa zaraʿa hā
wa ʾasǧala man šāʾa wa zaraʿa man ʾaḥabba wa ʾalzama nafsa hu ʿimāraẗa ḏālika wa ăt tamāma bi hā ʿalà ăš šarāʾiṭi ăṯ ṯābitaẗi
fī dīwāni ăl ḫarāǧi dūna muzāḥima bni ʾisḥāqa wa la dafaʿa ʾananiyāsu ʾantanāsu ʾantibāsu ʾasāsu bnu sisinnaha bni ʾananiyāsa ʾantanāsa ʾantibāsa ʾasāsa ăn nawāʾiyyu ǧamīʿa ḫarāǧi ḏālika
ʿammā yaǧibu li ḥaqqi bayti ăl māli dūna ḥaqq:in li māʾ:in min ḫarāǧi salāʾiḫi ʾarāḍī ăl ʾamlāki ăl maḏkūraẗi fī hāḏā
ăl kitābi *** dūna *** muzāḥima *** bni *** ʾisḥāqa li sanaẗayni mutawāliyatayni ʾūlà hunna sanaẗu ʾarbaʿa ʿašraẗa wa ṯalāṯi miʾaẗ:in
wa ʾāḫiraẗu hunna sanaẗu ḫamsa ʿašraẗa wa ṯalāṯi miʾaẗ:in ʿalà ăš šarāʾiṭi ăṯ ṯābitaẗi fī dīwāni ăl ḫarāǧi bi ăl māli
**** ʾ** ʿalà ʾan yuʾaddiya māla mā ăl *** ḫarāǧi
*** ʿalay hā himā wa wāǧib:un ʿalay hi ʾadāʾu hā maʿa mā yaǧibu
‮**** ***ān min ăr rasmi fī ḏālika dūna muzāḥima bni ʾisḥāqa
*** lā yudāfiʿu hu wa lā yaḥtaǧǧu fī hi bi ḥuǧǧaẗ:in bi waǧh:in min ăl wuǧūhi wa lā sabab:in
mina ăl ʾasbābi **** ṣBẗ wa lā ẓamʾa wa lā ĭstibḥāra wa lā ʿalà ăl wuǧūhi wa ăl ʾasbābi
kulli hā *** min ăs sinīna ăl muʾarraḫaẗi fī hāḏā ăl kitābi ****
*** min qibali ʾaḥad:in min ăs salāṭīni ʾaw ʾaṣḥābi ăl ḫarāǧi ʾaw ** ʿummāli kuttābi him him ***
**** mina ăl wuǧūhi wa ăl ʾasbābi kulli hā fa ʿalà ʾananiyāsa ʾantanāsa ʾantibāsa ʾasāsa bni sisinnaha bni ʾananiyāsa ʾantanāsa ʾantibāsa ʾasāsa ăn nawāʾiyyi
**** min ḫāliṣi māli hi wa ʾawfari hi wa ʾaḫṣari hi wa ḍamina la hu ǧamīʿa ḏālika ḍamān:an lāzim:an la hu fī ḏimmaẗi hi * ***

[In] the nam[e] of Go[d], the [Co]mpassiona[te, the Mercif]ul [In] the na[me] of Go[d] th[e mer]ci[ful] and compassionate
The witnesses named [in] this deed have testified to the acknowledgmen[t] by Antanâs b. Sisinna b. Antanâs, residing in the village kn[ow]n The witnesses named [in] this writing bore witness to the affirmati[on] of Antanās ibn Sisinah ibn Antanās, residing in the village kn[ow]n
as Nawāyah, one of the villages of Lower Ushmūn, [that h]e was present with them and that he [ca]lled th[em t]o witness on his beha[lf] in the soundness of his mind and of his body and the lawfullness of as Nawâye, one of the villages of Lower-Ašmûn, [that] he had come into their presence and had ca[lled them t]o witness as to his [responsibility], he being in a state of sound mind and body and capable of transacting
his business; that the fallow lands of the lan[d]ed property known as Hôr Qolte and (originally) named in reference to Bqâm b. Helistûs, belonging to that which passed his instruction. Verily the fallow f[iel]ds of the properties known as Hūr Qultah, ascribed to Biqām ibn Halistūs, part of what had been
in the name of Jirjah Quzmān in the auction of [Na]wāyah, part of what Muzāḥim ibn Isḥaq ibn Mu[ḥ]ammad ibn Aḥmad the executive of Abū Aḥmad al-Ḥasan under the name of Ǧirǧe Quzmân at the auction of [Na]wâye, (and) which Muzâḥim b. Isḥâq b. [Mu]ḥammad b. Aḥmad, the finance-administrator of Abû Aḥmad al-Ḥasan
b. Muḥa[mma]d, entrusted with the admi[nis]tration of the taxe[s] [and] do[ma]ins and .............. in the districts of al-Ušmûnain, had taken on lease for four successive years ibn Muḥa[mma]d over the adm[in]istration of the kharā[j] and the es[ta]tes [and] the environs of their two [i.e., the kharāj and the estates] villages in Ushmūnayn leased for four successive years
reckoning from the year three hundred and twe[l]ve and ending with the year three hundred and fifteen, for twenty dînârs, miṯqâlî the first of them being the year twel[ve] and three hundred and the last of them being the year fifteen and three hundred for twenty washed weight measures dinars coins of the ca[sh] [of the treas]u[r]y, in gold,
and it was weighted out, ap[art from] what is imposed on it [f]or the rent and [...] Verily the two of them are gold-coins, correctly counted out according to the stand[ard] and weight [of the Trea]sury apart [fr]om what has been agreed upon as the rent and the ......... for they are
free from this burden reckoning at five dînârs yearly, seeing that this (was) his possession and that of his ancestors before him, and that it is outside of this tot[al]. And that is reckoning at five dinars for each year. Verily, that is property belonging to him and belonging to his father before him. Verily it
[a ten]an[cy of Mu]zâ[ḥi]m [be]n I[s]ḥâq, it really belonging to him, that [he handed it over to him. Thus] Mu[z]âḥim b. Isḥâq has handed this over to Antanâs b. Sisinna is the [ten]anc[y of M]uzā[ḥ]im i[b]n I[s]ḥaq. And that is his to [hand over to him. And] Mu[z]āḥim ibn Isḥaq [ha]n[d]ed that [ov]er to Antanās ibn Sisinah
[b]en Antanâs, originating from Nawâye, and Antanâs [b.] Sisinna b. Antanâs, originating from Nawâye, has acknowledged, that he has taken over from Muzâḥim i[b]n Antanās of Nawāyah. And Antanās [ibn] Sisinah ibn Antanās of Nawāyah affirmed that the fallow fields of the properties mentioned in this writing were handed over by Muzāḥim
b. Isḥâq the fallow lands of the landed property mentioned in this deed, and he has taken it into his own possession for cultivation, ibn Isḥaq. And he took possession of them for himself for their cultivation.
And whom he wishes can register them. And [whomever] he likes can cultivate them. And he himself is responsible for the assessment of that, the whole of it according to the conditions established so that whoever wills may register (it), and [whoever] desires may cultivate (it), and he has bound himself to the amelioration thereof and to carry through (all matters) concerned therewith according to the conditions established
in the kharāj office [under] Muzāḥim ibn Isḥaq. And Antanās ibn Sisinah ibn Antanās of Nawāyah will de[liv]er all of the kharāj. in the tax-office, [in the presence of] Muzâḥim b. Isḥâq; and Antanâs b. Sisinna b. Antanâs, originating from Nawâye, is to p[a]y the whole of the land-tax thereof
from what is obligatory as Treasury dues beyond the [water] cess of the land-tax for the fallow lands mentioned in this That is for what is imposed for the right of the treasury, under the right for wa[t]er, part of the kharāj of the irrigated fallow fields of the properties mentioned in this
[d]ee[d .......... ] for two successive years reckoning from the year t[hree] hu[ndred] and fourteen wri[ting under Muzāḥim ibn Isḥaq] for two successive years the first of them being the year fourteen and t[hree] hu[ndred]
[and ending with the year] three [hun]dre[d] and [fifteen accor]d[ing] to the [condi]tions established in the tax-office in the mon[ey] [and the last of them being the year fifteen] and three [hun]dr[ed accor]d[ing] to the [stipula]tions established in the kharāj office for the pro[perty]
[ .......... ] on condition that he fulfill what [ [ .......... ] ... that he may pay the money [for the land-tax]
[ .......... ] incumbent thereon and whose payment is obligatory upon him together with that which is agreed upon [ .......... ] on it. It is his duty to fulfill it together with that is imposed on
[ .......... ]ān of the schedule in that, under Muzāḥim ibn Isḥaq [ .......... ] ... of the impost thereof (?) in the presence of Muzâḥim b. Isḥâq
[ .......... he will not de]lay the payment thereof nor will he bring forward any pretext in respect thereto for any cause or reason [ .......... he will not re]sist it, nor will he dispute it with a document for any cause or any
[reason ..........] (...) neither aridity nor flooding, and not for causes and not for reasons [whatever ..........]... nor aridity nor inundation nor from [all] causes and reasons
[all of them .......... ] of the years dated [in] this writing [ [whatever .......... ] of the years mentioned as the date in this deed .........
[ .......... from] one of the governors of finance-directors or ............ [ .......... from] the part of anyone of the authorities or kharāj associates, or [
[ ....... causes and reaso]ns, all of them. Finally to the debit of Antanās ibn Sisinah ibn Antanās of Nawāyah is [.............] [ ....... for whatever cause or] reason there may be then (it falls) upon Antanâs b. Sisinna b. Antanâs, originating from Nawâye,
[ .................. be it abundant or straitened, and he guaran]teed all of that to him as a gua[ran]tee that he is res[po]nsible for out of [his] lia[bi]lity. [ .................. out of his own means whether this be abundant or meagre and he gua]ranteed all this to him as a guarantee binding upon him in respect to his obligation. [.....]
